page.title: 01LANDSCAPE & TOPOGRAPHY
page.content:
TOPOGRAPHY
The river known as the Afon Senni flows northwards across the western part of the block,to flow eventually into the R.Usk at Sennybridge,4 km to the north west. This part of the Senni valley lies at a height of 240-280 metres above sea level. The valley is steep-sided to the west but the northern and central parts of the block is undulating land rising to about 330 metres. The highest land is in the south east where the peak of FAN FRYNYCH rises to 629 metres. The steep north west face of this hill,which is one of the lesser summits of the Brecon Beacons, dominates the landscape. The area is sparsely populated and the settlement everywhere comprises small isolated farms.
